Memory.h

00001 #ifndef MEMORY_H
00002 #define MEMORY_H
00003 
00004 //include <Unsorted.h>
00005 
00006 /*
00007  * The memory (de)allocators have to match!
00008  * Do not allocate memory in the DLL and hand it to the game to deallocate, or vice versa.
00009  * Kapiche?
00010 
00011  * A simple |auto foo = new IngameClass();| allocates memory from the DLL's pool.
00012  * But |delete foo;| deallocates memory from the game's own pool. (assuming the class you're freeing has a virtual SDDTOR)
00013 
00014  * So use the macros to make sure game classes go to the game's pool.
00015  * The custom classes like ExtMap do not need this treatment so you can use the plain old new/delete on them.
00016 
00017  * For the ObjectClass derivates, if you use the game's built-in allocators like | Type->CreateObject() | ,
00018  * you can use plain | delete |;
00019 
00020  */
00021 
00022 /*
00023  * OK, new plan - the game's operator new/delete has been hooked to redirect to the DLL's
00024  * so GAME_(DE)ALLOC is now just a wrapper. Don't remove it though, just in case this fails
00025  * and I need to run those allocations differently.
00026  */
00027 
00028 /*
00029  * Newer plan - previous hook screwed performance, so going back
00030  */
00031 
00032 // allocate scalars
00033 template<typename T>
00034 static void * _cdecl Allocate(bool inDLL) {
00035         size_t sz = sizeof(T);
00036 
00037         if(inDLL) {
00038                 return operator new(sz);
00039         }
00040 
00041         PUSH_VAR32(sz);
00042         CALL(0x7C8E17);
00043         ADD_ESP(4);
00044 };
00045 
00046 #define DO_ALLOC(inDLL, TT, var, ...) \
00047 { \
00048         void *p = Allocate<TT>(inDLL); \
00049         if(p) { \
00050                 var = new (p) TT(__VA_ARGS__); \
00051         } else { \
00052                 ExitProcess(1); \
00053         } \
00054 } \
00055 
00056 // allocate in the game's pool
00057 #define GAME_ALLOC(TT, var, ...) \
00058 { \
00059         DO_ALLOC(0, TT, var, __VA_ARGS__); \
00060 }
00061 
00062 //      var = new TT(__VA_ARGS__); 
00063 
00064 // allocate in the DLL's pool
00065 // not sure if this is ever going to be needed
00066 #define DLL_ALLOC(TT, var, ...) \
00067 { \
00068         DO_ALLOC(1, TT, var, __VA_ARGS__);\
00069 } \
00070 
00071 // allocate vectors
00072 template<typename T>
00073 static void * _cdecl Allocate_Array(bool inDLL, size_t Capacity) {
00074         size_t sz = sizeof(T) * Capacity;
00075 
00076         if(inDLL) {
00077                 return operator new(sz);
00078         }
00079 
00080         PUSH_VAR32(sz);
00081         CALL(0x7C8E17);
00082         ADD_ESP(4);
00083 };
00084 
00085 // allocate arrays
00086 #define DO_ALLOC_ARR(inDLL, TT, Capacity, var) \
00087 { \
00088         void *p = Allocate_Array<TT>(inDLL, Capacity); \
00089         if(p) { \
00090                 var = new (p) TT[Capacity]; \
00091         } else { \
00092                 ExitProcess(1); \
00093         } \
00094 } \
00095 
00096 // allocate array in the game's pool
00097 #define GAME_ALLOC_ARR(TT, Capacity, var) \
00098 { \
00099         DO_ALLOC_ARR(0, TT, Capacity, var); \
00100 }
00101 
00102 // deallocate scalars
00103 template<typename T>
00104 static void _cdecl Deallocate(T* Tptr, bool inDLL) {
00105         Tptr->~T();
00106         if(inDLL) {
00107                 operator delete(Tptr);
00108                 return;
00109         }
00110         PUSH_VAR32(Tptr);
00111         CALL(0x7C8B3D);
00112         ADD_ESP(4);
00113 };
00114 
00115 // deallocate from the game's pool
00116 #define GAME_DEALLOC(var) \
00117 { \
00118         Deallocate(var, 0); \
00119 } \
00120 
00121 //      delete var; 
00122 
00123 // deallocate from the DLL's pool
00124 #define DLL_DEALLOC(var) \
00125 { \
00126         Deallocate(var, 1); \
00127 } \
00128 
00129 // deallocate vectors
00130 template<typename T>
00131 static void _cdecl Deallocate_Array(T* Tptr, bool inDLL) {
00132         Tptr->~T();
00133         if(inDLL) {
00134                 operator delete[](Tptr);
00135                 return;
00136         }
00137         PUSH_VAR32(Tptr);
00138         CALL(0x7C8B3D);
00139         ADD_ESP(4);
00140 };
00141 
00142 // deallocate from the game's pool
00143 #define GAME_DEALLOC_ARR(var) \
00144 { \
00145         Deallocate_Array(var, 0); \
00146 } \
00147 
00148 #endif
